body_html: Is this really a good solution? This kind of B -> A, C -> A, C -> B dependency between libraries is very common, even in PyTorch (think A = TH, B = THC, C = ATen), and it usually ends just fine without linking errors. What makes cpuinfo different?
body_text: Is this really a good solution? This kind of B -> A, C -> A, C -> B dependency between libraries is very common, even in PyTorch (think A = TH, B = THC, C = ATen), and it usually ends just fine without linking errors. What makes cpuinfo different?
body: Is this really a good solution? This kind of `B -> A, C -> A, C -> B` dependency between libraries is very common, even in PyTorch (think `A = TH, B = THC, C = ATen`), and it usually ends just fine without linking errors. What makes cpuinfo different?
